comment: The move order favoured by Kosten in his "The Dynamic English"

Now we have a reversed Sicilian 2.c3 where White has the extra move 2.g3 I've
long held the view that 2...Nf6 is Black's best against 2.c3 so maybe I should
have played 3.Nf3here

moves: 1. c4 e5 2. g3 c6 3. d4 exd4 4. Qxd4 d5 5. cxd5 cxd5 6. Bg2 Be6
1. c4 e5 2. g3 c6 3. d4 exd4 4. Qxd4 d5 5. cxd5 cxd5 6. Bg2 Be6 7. Nf3 Nc6 8. Qa4 Bc5 9. O-O
comment:
Now we have a position similar to that in Tarrasch Defence where Black's easy
development and active pieces compensate for the supposedly weakpawnatd5
